reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights in this beautifull hotel. It is located slightly off the center of Brugge, a ten minutes walk or 5 minutes bus journey. Convenient and on the other hand
reviews.title: Location,confort and friendliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: quiet and peacefull.
reviews.title: A great find and lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we stayed in, facing the canal, was confortable, spacious , big windows and spotless clean.
reviews.title: Great Spot

reviews.text: The owners and their staff went out of their way to make us fill welcome .
reviews.title: What a lovely find on our first visit to Brugges.

reviews.text: In summary dont look any further.
reviews.title: Another fantastic stay in this charming, friendly hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights after reviewing tripadvisor. Very attractive hotel slightly out of the main tourist area (be prepared for a 10-15 minute walk from the heart of Brugges). Staff very attentive, polite and professional. Great breakfast. Slightly disappointed by room; although spotlessly clean and having a very good bathroom, bedroom lacked natural light. Only reason for 4 stars, however in conclusion I would stay there again. Easy to get to from station, just hop on bus, for a couple of Euros, and it drops right outside.
reviews.title: Great little hotel, slightly outside of the main tourist area run by an enthusiastic and professional team.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a driving trip from Amsterdam to Normandy and rolled into Bruges with no reservations or ideas. I chose this place because it had a parking space open in front of it. What a stroke of luck. It was about a 10 minute walk to the town square, and set on a less heavily traveled street. . The rooms were very nicely updated, with a private bath and large bathtub. We had a balcony overlooking the city and a garden they have out back. The breakfast room was four-star service and presentation. Every staff member was friendly and eager to engage in conversation. I loved this place.
reviews.title: Overjoyed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a remarkable time at the Hotel Ter Duinen. Although Bruges is such a magical place that almost any hotel would suffice, Ter Duinen stands apart from the crowd because of its beautiful location and its wonderful proprietors. The hotel is a short walk from the crowded center of town, which means that you can enjoy the gorgeous canal view without being crushed by tourists. In addition, there is a real sense of care and attention from the staff (who seem to be one family as far as we could tell). The best example of this is the free breakfast every morning. Instead of a continental buffet with runny scrambled eggs like you'd find at most American hotels, Ter Duinen offers a gourmet meal with everything you could ask for, including fresh-squeezed orange juice and soft-boiled eggs delivered to the table within seconds of sitting down. It's above and beyond, just like everything else we experienced here. What a great hotel in one of Europe's greatest cities!
reviews.title: Charming family operation with storybook views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for five days and were delighted with the warm and attentive service in this excellent little hotel which is located just a short walk from the main square in Brugge.
reviews.title: An outstanding little Hotel in Brugge!

reviews.text: Since Brugge is a very busy tourist area, the location, a short walking distance out of the tourist area, was a distinct advantage. The owners make sure the place is well run, with only the highest quality served for the excellent breakfast.
reviews.title: Great People, delicious breakfast and nicely decorated rooms
Lovely, welcoming hotel - I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Bruges
reviews.text: What a lovely two nights my mum, my sister and I spent at Hotel Ter Duinen - our stay was really lovely from start to finish: warm, genuine welcome; lovely big triple room with views out over the canal and neighboring rooftops; everything super clean as well as stylishly presented; excellent "out of the norm" breakfast; super location for seeing the sites and having a quiet night.

reviews.title: Great Breakfast, ok service.
reviews.text: I'll be recommending this hotel to friends and will definately stay here on my next visit.

reviews.title: Too good to be true, but it is.
reviews.text: As many others have stated, this hotel provides an excellent breakfast. Fresh croissants, fresh fruit, meats and cheeses, it's a great way to start your day and they serve it until 10:00 so you can even sleep in a little.

reviews.title: Lovely, friendly hotel great breakfast!
reviews.text: The location was also very nice - close to the Markt, but far enough away to not be noisy. We felt completely safe walking back to the hotel every night, even if it was around midnight.

reviews.title: Terrific Small Three-Star Hotel in Bruges
reviews.text: The quality of the rooms was ok - I would have wished for more luxury with the pricetag. Everything was clean, so that's good. There are probably other hotels in Bruges that offer more bang for your buck.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the Hotel Ter Duinen on Trip Advisor and we were very pleased with it. The very considerate and hospitable owners made our 2 night stay most pleasant. Our room was on the ground floor, street side and was large for a European hotel room. The beds were comfortable and we heard little to no noise from the street because of the double windows. On the first night we could not get the rolladen, outside shade, to come down on the window and this, for me, was not good because I cannot sleep with light coming in. We called the desk and Marc, the owner came right away and was able to get the shade down. It was stuck from the outside. I asked about using the air conditioner since we could not leave the window open because the room was on the street. He brought the remote control right away and we had a very cool and pleasant night's sleep. Many have written about the breakfast and it lived up to all the reviews. Very lovely dining room and a wonderful variety of foods for anyone's taste. Fresh, hot coffee with a second pot on request was appreciated. Brugge is a charming city and a place I would recommend. I would definitely return to Brugge and the Hotel Ter Duinen. The only downside was that there was no shower curtain. I asked Marc about it and he said that there was one before but that I had not been replaced and that he would see to that.
reviews.title: Really Charming and Comfortable Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Ter Duinen for 3 nights for a mini-holiday. After many hours reading reviews on trip advisor, I plumped for this hotel, even though it was a bit more expensive than we would normally pay. We were both very happy with my choice! The best things about this hotel are definitely the friendly and helpful staff and the breakfasts which were wonderful and one of the best hotel breakfasts I have ever had (the other being a 5 star luxury hotel in Delhi). They put so much effort into presentation and quality, which I really appreciated; little individual fresh fruit salads, and a plate of prepared fruit delivered to your table, such as strawberries and the biggest cherries I have ever seen! An excellent selection of breads, and very good quality meats and chesses (I don't usually bother with these, but the brie was too good to miss!) Cereals, yogurts and good selection of teabags too! The hotel is very well located on the canalside, and the main square is within 10 minutes walk. You can catch the bus from the train station quite easily, and it drops you off right opposite the hotel. I paid a little extra for one of the recently refurbished rooms. If I am being totally honest, I was a little disappointed with the room and this is the only reason I have not given Ter Duinen 5 stars. There was not that much natural light, so it was a bit dark, and rather spartan in terms of decoration - a few pictures on the wall might help. It wasn't a room I wanted to spend that much time in beyond the necessities. That being said, the bathroom was lovely with an excellent shower - big cubicle and powerful. The bed was also very comfy and the bedding clean and of good quality. The TV had lots of English channels so were were able to watch BBC news every morning! Some coat hangers and hot drinks tray would also be welcomed. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel and Bruges as a destination.
reviews.title: Lovely stay with a fabulous breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had the pleasure of spending two nights at the Hotel Ter Duinen June, 2011. The hotel is in a great location with a scenic walk to the main square. Parking was in a garage, an app. 2 minute walk from the hotel. The breakfast was very good: pastries, yogurt, eggs, fresh fruit and even Belgian chocolates! The owners and staff are very friendly and accommodating. Overall, the hotel is a perfect choice to stay in beautiful Bruges.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.text: Finding a hotel through the internet has been in the past a mixed bag until we discovered the gem called Hotel Ter Duinen. Orginally we planned to only stay two nights but once we toured the very charming Euro antique modern facility, met the terrific hosts and saw our Aerican sized room we chose to extend our stay. In 12 daystravel though euope and 7 previous visits to the continent we found this hotel rated the best we've come across. I wish we could find the same quality value and detailing in every city we visit.
reviews.title: Magical Bruges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy to get to with good parking nearby. Staff very caring & keen to ensure you make the most of your stay in Bruges. The room we had was a little smaller than expected but still comfortable with lovely view of the canal. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent position for a comfortable stay in Bruges
